Legal_Issue: Whether the Visa Officer erred in rejecting Ms. Eslamieh's application for permanent residency without considering discretion under subsection 76(3) of IRPA
Legal_Rule: Subsection 76(3) of IRPA allows discretion if points do not sufficiently indicate economic establishment, but discretion must be requested by the applicant
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error by Visa Officer in not applying discretion under subsection 76(3)
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No obligation for Visa Officer to apply discretion unsolicited
Key_Evidence_Considered: Ms. Eslamieh scored one point below the threshold
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged rejection of permanent residency application
Defendant_Response: Decision was within legal standards and reasonable
Evidence_Type: Application scoring, failure to request discretion
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Visa Officer's decision
Remedy_Sought: Overturning of visa refusal and grant of permanent residency
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient points under economic class criteria
Applicable_Process: Permanent residency application under economic class
